The Miombo woodlands are vital ecosystems for both communities and wildlife. The Mlele Forest Reserve, located in Mlele District, is a prime example, providing essential resources and serving as a crucial year-round water catchment via the Kapapa River.

![The kapapa river at Mlele Forest Reserve](pic02.jpg)

- The Mlele Hill Forest Reserve is ecologically vital, crucially maintaining water quality. The perennial flow of the Kapapa River is a direct indicator of the forest's health and its support for wildlife.
